page.title: 14POPULATION
page.content: There are fewer than 500 people living in this block which is just less than 5 square miles in area and 2 of the grid squares have no people at all. Out of such a small population it is remarkable how long-lived many are particularly among the indigenous families.Between 1900 and 1929 there were 108 burials in Westbury, 12 of babies less than a year but 13 were 60 to 70, 35 were 70 to 80 and 22 were over 80.These were all born in the early 19th.c. in very hard conditons. At the same time there were 34 marriages in Westbury whilst 79 boys and 58 girls were christened. Today there may be 2 or 3 christenings, 1 wedding and 1 or 2 funerals a year. Although only a few new houses have been built there has been an influx of population so that today only about \ the families predate the 1931 change.
